column4: oh c'mon, this has gotta be easy, and probably important. WHERE IS MY DESKTOP< WHAT IS WRONG WITH NAUTILUS? PLEASE. . .
Any clues in the system logfiles?
That shouldn't keep the desktop from loading.
What happens if you type, "sudo /etc/init.d/gdm start" at the command line?
Does it load up to a a desktop environment?
I see.  For some reason I thought you were stuck at a command prompt.
What was the last thing you did before it stopped working?
Yeah you may want to follow up on the Nautilus errors you mentioned.  Try removing the addons.
You can always add the Nautilus scripts back after you fix the problem.
Did you remove the addon scripts?
What ended up being the thing that allowed it to load?
I had stepped away from the computer for a few minutes...
Strange.  Oh well, glad your back up and running though.
Did you add that extension or is it part of the normal package?
Remove it then.  Maybe an updated (less buggy) one will be available soon.
You may even find that the writer of that extension has an updated one available to address that issue.
